snippet: Johnson & Johnson’s Baby Shampoo no longer contains two potentially harmful chemicals, formaldehyde and 1,4-dioxane, that have come under increasing scrutiny by consumers.
abstract: Johnson & Johnson announces its trademark baby shampoo and 100 other baby products will no longer contain formaldehyde and 1,4-dioxane; move fulfills pledge made in the face of consumer pressure two years earlier and is first step in companywide effort to remove increasingly unpopular chemicals from its personal care products.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson’s Baby Shampoo no longer contains two potentially harmful chemicals, formaldehyde and 1,4-dioxane, that have come under increasing scrutiny by consumers.

headline.main: The ‘No More Tears’ Shampoo, Now With No Formaldehyde
headline.print_headline: The ‘No More Tears’ Shampoo, Now With No Formaldehyde
